meanings.sent1: I mizzed the directions and got lost.
meanings.sent2: She always mizzes when faced with a difficult puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked mizzed trying to catch its tail.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a mizz of thoughts, swirling and tangled.
meanings.sent5: The tricky riddle left everyone mizzed and scratching their heads.

meanings.definition: A title of respect for a young woman.
meanings.sent1: The kind mizz helped me find my way.
meanings.sent2: I saw a friendly mizz at the store today.
meanings.sent3: The wise mizz shared her knowledge with the group.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the village mizz, admired by all.
meanings.sent5: The young mizz greeted everyone with a warm smile.

meanings.sent1: The flowers bloomed after the morning mizz.
meanings.sent2: We decided to walk in the refreshing mizz.
meanings.sent3: The gentle mizz made the leaves glisten in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The fields were nourished by the soft mizz that fell.
meanings.sent5: The mizz kissed my cheeks as I strolled through the garden.
